required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: CoolSculpting the Upper Arm Using a Vacuum Applicator

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the safety and efficacy of the ZELTIQ CoolSculpting System using a specialized surface applicator for non-invasive subcutaneous fat reduction in the upper arm.

detailed_description.textblock: This multi-center trial will evaluate the Zeltiq CoolSculpting treatment to perform treatments in the upper arm for the reduction subcutaneous fat reduction.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Pre-treatment Images Correctly Identified
primary_outcome.description: Change in the treated vs. untreated areas will be assessed by observation of changes in surface contour and/or fat volume by an independent photo review of pre-treatment and post-treatment images of the treated areas. The review panel will consist of practicing dermatologists or plastic surgeons. All reviewers will be blinded to post-treatment vs. baseline untreated area. The order in which images will be presented will be randomized; for each subject placement of the baseline, pre-treatment image will be randomized for each pair of subject images. Reviewers will be asked to select the baseline photos for each subject photo series and record selections on a data collection form. Correct identification of photos by at least 2 of the 3 reviewers has an expected success rate of 75%.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of the CoolSculpting Device in Upper Arm Treatments
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of reported unanticipated adverse device effects (UADE) from the time of enrollment through the 12-week follow-up visit will be collected and analyzed. It is expected there will be zero UADE's reported.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Upper arm treatment with vacuum applicator
arm_group.description: Subjects with clearly visible fat sufficient for treatment received bilateral CoolSculpting treatments, 1 treatment on each arm.

intervention.description: The CoolSculpting device with a vacuum applicator will be used to perform the treatments.
intervention.arm_group_label: Upper arm treatment with vacuum applicator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Male or female subjects > 22 years of age and < 65 years of age.
- Subject has clearly visible fat sufficient for treatment on the upper arm, which in the investigator's opinion, may benefit from the treatment.
- No weight change exceeding 5% in the preceding month.
- Subject agrees to maintain his/her weight (i.e., within 5% of total body weight) by not making any major changes in their diet or exercise routine during the course of the study.
- Subject has read and signed the study written informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria
- History of a fat reduction procedure (e.g., liposuction, surgery, lipolytic agents, etc.), or implants in or adjacent to the area of intended treatment.
- History of prior surgery in the arms.
- Known history of cryoglobulinemia, cold urticaria, cold agglutinin disease, or paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria.
- Known history of Raynaud's disease, or any known condition with a response to cold exposure that limits blood flow to the skin.
- History of bleeding disorder or is taking any medication that in the investigator's opinion may increase the subject's risk of bruising.
- History of carpal tunnel syndrome, compartment syndrome or deep vein thrombosis in the upper extremities.
- Currently taking or has taken diet pills or weight control supplements within the past month.
- Any dermatological conditions, such as scars, infection, in the location of the treatment area that may interfere with the treatment or evaluation.
- Active implanted device such as a pacemaker, defibrillator, or drug delivery system.
- Pregnant or intending to become pregnant in the next 5 months.
- Lactating or has been lactating in the past 6 months.
- Unable or unwilling to comply with the study requirements.
- Currently enrolled in a clinical study of any other unapproved investigational drug or device. Any other condition or laboratory value that would, in the professional opinion of the investigator, potentially affect the subject's response or the integrity of the data or would pose an unacceptable risk to the subject.

facility.name: Dr. Jean Carruthers Cosmetic Surgery Inc.

results_reference.citation: Carruthers JD, Humphrey S, Rivers JK. Cryolipolysis for Reduction of Arm Fat: Safety and Efficacy of a Prototype CoolCup Applicator With Flat Contour. Dermatol Surg. 2017 Jul;43(7):940-949. doi: 10.1097/DSS.0000000000001134.

group.title: Upper Arm Treatment Group
group.description: Each subject in the arm received bilateral treatment with the CoolSculpting device. Each arm was treated once.

group.title: Upper Arm Treatment With Vacuum Applicator
group.description: The CoolSculpting device with vacuum applicator will be used to administer treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Pre-treatment Images Correctly Identified
outcome.description: Change in the treated vs. untreated areas will be assessed by observation of changes in surface contour and/or fat volume by an independent photo review of pre-treatment and post-treatment images of the treated areas. The review panel will consist of practicing dermatologists or plastic surgeons. All reviewers will be blinded to post-treatment vs. baseline untreated area. The order in which images will be presented will be randomized; for each subject placement of the baseline, pre-treatment image will be randomized for each pair of subject images. Reviewers will be asked to select the baseline photos for each subject photo series and record selections on a data collection form. Correct identification of photos by at least 2 of the 3 reviewers has an expected success rate of 75%.
outcome.population: Thirty subjects received bilateral treatments to the upper arms. Three subjects did not maintain weight per-protocol requirements and were excluded from the primary efficacy analysis.

group.title: Upper Arm Treatment With Vacuum Applicator
group.description: The CoolSculpting device with vacuum applicator will be used to administer treatment.

measure.title: Percentage of Pre-treatment Images Correctly Identified
measure.description: Change in the treated vs. untreated areas will be assessed by observation of changes in surface contour and/or fat volume by an independent photo review of pre-treatment and post-treatment images of the treated areas. The review panel will consist of practicing dermatologists or plastic surgeons. All reviewers will be blinded to post-treatment vs. baseline untreated area. The order in which images will be presented will be randomized; for each subject placement of the baseline, pre-treatment image will be randomized for each pair of subject images. Reviewers will be asked to select the baseline photos for each subject photo series and record selections on a data collection form. Correct identification of photos by at least 2 of the 3 reviewers has an expected success rate of 75%.
measure.population: Thirty subjects received bilateral treatments to the upper arms. Three subjects did not maintain weight per-protocol requirements and were excluded from the primary efficacy analysis.

outcome.title: Safety of the CoolSculpting Device in Upper Arm Treatments
outcome.description: The incidence of reported unanticipated adverse device effects (UADE) from the time of enrollment through the 12-week follow-up visit will be collected and analyzed. It is expected there will be zero UADE's reported.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of subjects to whom treatment was administered and who completed the 12 week post-treatment visit.

group.title: Upper Arm Treatment With Vacuum Applicator
group.description: The CoolSculpting device with vacuum applicator will be used to administer treatment.

measure.title: Safety of the CoolSculpting Device in Upper Arm Treatments
measure.description: The incidence of reported unanticipated adverse device effects (UADE) from the time of enrollment through the 12-week follow-up visit will be collected and analyzed. It is expected there will be zero UADE's reported.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of subjects to whom treatment was administered and who completed the 12 week post-treatment visit.

reported_events.time_frame: Enrollment through the 12 week follow-up visit.

group.title: Upper Arm Treatment With Vacuum Applicator
group.description: The CoolSculpting device with vacuum applicator will be used to administer treatment.

event.description: Four (4) subjects reported prolonged numbness. Bilateral numbness was documented for 3 of the 4 subjects; unilateral numbness was reported for 1 subject.
One (1) subject reported minor tingling in the fourth and fifth fingers of one hand immediately after the applicator was removed. The tingling resolved within 20 minutes post-treatment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Kerrie Jiang, Executive Director, Regulatory, Clinical and Medical Affairs
